title: Interactive Map
text:
Interactive Map Demo
The map below demonstrates how an externally hosted, interactive web map can be embedded directly into a Quarto website using a simple HTML iframe. This example shows a neighborhood-scale dataset displayed through a Leaflet map exported from QGIS using the qgis2web plugin.






About This Demonstration

Workflow Overview (Placeholder Text)
This page is part of a demonstration showing how to build a simple project site using Quarto and embed an interactive map hosted elsewhere. The general structure is as follows:

Create the map in a GIS environment Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed sed dignissim elit.
Export the map as a web-ready visualization Nullam posuere magna in nibh tincidunt, non facilisis eros dignissim. Ut laoreet consequat vehicula.

This workflow enables flexible publishing workflows where maps, narrative content, and supporting materials can be managed and hosted independently.

title: DC Heritage Cherry Trees
text:
This project demonstrates a simple workflow for publishing interactive web maps using free and open-source tools. The example map highlights a subset of urban trees within a metropolitan area and illustrates how spatial data can be shared online without requiring specialized accounts or licensed platforms.
